context: The IT consulting industry is projected to reach $759.6 billion in 2025 with growth of 1.9%. Accenture maintains the largest market share among IT consulting firms in the US. Competition is high and increasing, driven by AI consulting services (projected to exceed $90.99 billion by 2035 at 26.2% CAGR) and cloud consulting services (estimated to reach $500 billion by 2033 at 15% CAGR). The market has evolved beyond traditional advisory to comprehensive digital transformation solutions.

competitors.name: Deloitte Consulting
competitors.notes: Best overall alternative with extensive global footprint spanning 150+ countries, competing directly in technology and digital transformation

competitors.name: IBM Consulting
competitors.notes: Top competitor with diverse portfolio including AI, quantum computing, cloud services, and blockchain innovation

competitors.name: Capgemini Services
competitors.notes: Leading European consulting firm with strength in data analytics, AI, digital engineering, and creative acquisitions

competitors.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC)
competitors.notes: Major Big Four competitor offering digital transformation and risk management consulting

competitors.name: KPMG
competitors.notes: Big Four firm with strong risk and regulatory consulting practice

competitors.name: Ernst & Young (EY)
competitors.notes: Big Four professional services firm with comprehensive technology and advisory services

competitors.name: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS)
competitors.notes: Leading Indian IT services firm with reputation for execution and reliability in IT and outsourcing

competitors.name: Infosys
